alert.note: Alert for Inland Indian River; Inland St. Lucie; Okeechobee; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 3:57PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern St. Lucie, Okeechobee, southwestern Indian River and southeastern Osceola Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 357 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fort Drum, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Basinger, Fort Drum, Kissimmee Prairie Preserve, Whispering Pines and Country Hills Estates. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!

area.areaDesc: Inland Indian River; Inland St. Lucie; Okeechobee; Osceola
